page.title: 02Bramhope: Principle Features
page.content: The main feature of Bramhope is the noisy and busy{A660 Leeds - Otley road which cuts the village in half. Bramhope has expanded rapidly from a small agricultural village surrounded by farms, to an expensive commuter village for Leeds, with easy access to both city and countryside. Underneath the village runs{The Leeds {- Harrogate railway line}through the 2.25 mile long{Bramhope tunnel. Visible in the village are numerous large air shafts.{Golden Acre Park}is a country park with interesting fauna & flora and a nearby nature reserve. There are two hotels in Bramhope: The Post House and The Parkway, catering primarily for businessmen Two churches serve the community: St. Giles C. of E. and the Methodist Chapel. There is also a{Puritan Chapel - one of only two in England.
